net.kuujo.vertigo.input

Class Input

  • java.lang.Object
    • net.kuujo.vertigo.input.Input
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Serializable

    public class Input
extends Object
implements Serializable
    A component input. Inputs define a relationship between two components. Essentially, each input represents a subscription of the component to another component's output. Inputs also help define which messages the component is interested in receiving, and how to distribute messages between multiple instances of the component.
    Author:
    Jordan Halterman

    • Method Detail

      • id

        public String id()
        Returns the input id. This is a unique value used to identify identical inputs between multiple component instances.
        Returns:
        The input id.

      • getCount

        public int getCount()
        Returns the input count.
        Returns:
        The input count.

      • setCount

        public Input setCount(int count)
        Sets the input count. This indicates the total number of expected subscriptions from the input component and helps ensure consistency in message distribution between multiple component instances.
        Parameters:
        count - The input count.
        Returns:
        The called input instance.

      • getAddress

        public String getAddress()
        Returns the input address. This indicates the address to which the input listens.
        Returns:
        The input address.

      • groupBy

        public Input groupBy(Grouping grouping)
        Sets the input grouping. The input grouping indicates how messages should be distributed between multiple instances of the input component.
        Parameters:
        grouping - An input grouping.
        Returns:
        The called input instance.

      • getGrouping

        public Grouping getGrouping()
        Returns the current input grouping.
        Returns:
        The current input grouping.

      • filterBy

        public Input filterBy(Filter filter)
        Adds an input filter. Filters allow the input to specify which messages it is interested in receiving before they are sent.
        Parameters:
        filter - An input filter.
        Returns:
        The called input instance.

      • getFilters

        public List<Filter> getFilters()
        Returns a list of input filters.
        Returns:
        A list of input filters.
